title: Sending message failed
content:
thunderbird

when sending, an error comes up saying i cannot send more than 300 messages an hour but that is not the case, i am barely trying to send 10 an hour, need this fixed asap as my whole business runs around emails and need this fixed so as to not further inconvenience my business and clients.

Also getting lots of spam coming through suddenly
creator: glass2

title: Spam control
content: I am not sure whether this question should be classified under "Email and messaging" or "Settings" but here goes. I am getting a lot of emails from people and organizations that I would rather not open and look at or am bothered to do so. And setting up filters for each and every email sender would clutter up the workings of Thunderbird creating a significant lag during startup and mail download (am using IMAP). Is it possible to have a sender or organization set up in the message filter which then during the next go-around returns the email to sender with a subject line saying "Returned to sender, no such address"? Thanks for any consideration of this request. James
creator: smnckl

title: Address Book
content: Hi I recently changed over to Microsoft 11, my computer was installed and set up by Computer Help by a IT Consultant. My addresses are not like they use to be just come up names and addresses have disappeared which is frustrating. If I am unable to find out what is wrong I will go to Gmail only, which is a shame I have used TB for years. Ann Ferrari joeannferrari@gmail.com
creator: joeannferrari

title: can't reply or write a new emails
content: I hit some key by mistake while I was replying to an email and the message disappeared. It still showed up on the tool bar when I hover over the Tbird icon, but it will not click up onto the screen. I can no longer reply to emails or write a new email. I tried a system restore, which restored the old Thunderbird display (which I like better than the new one anyway) but it did not fix the problem, I still can't reply or write. I tried starting Tbird in safe mode but that didn't work either. I can't reply to messages or write a new message. All I can do is see incoming messages.
creator: edbdchi
